definitions.definition: to add a number to itself a particular number of times
definitions.sensetop: multiply A by Bmultiply A and B (together)multiply something up

examples.text: The children are already learning to multiply and divide.
Multiply the length by the width.
Multiply 2 and 6 together and you get 12.
If you are cooking for more people, just multiply up the quantities.
Your pension is a percentage of final salary multiplied by length of service.
The momentum of an object is defined as its mass multiplied by its velocity.

definitions.definition: to increase or make something increase very much in number or amount

examples.text: Our problems have multiplied since last year.
Cigarette smoking multiplies the risk of cancer.
The film was a great success, with screenings multiplying week by week.
Just imagine all the problems we've been having, multiplied a thousandfold.
Her bitterness was multiplied by his refusal to apologize.

definitions.definition: to produce young animals, bacteria, etc. in large numbers

examples.text: Protected reserves help tigers survive and multiply.
It is possible to multiply these bacteria in the laboratory.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French multiplier, from Latin multiplicare.
